channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why is Washington acting like the U.S. is in a recession?
item.description: On paper, the economy is growing and unemployment is low. But federal government policymakers are behaving like there is an imminent crisis.

item.title: Trump hails Milei’s Argentina win, says U.S. made ‘lot of money’
item.description: As recently as last Tuesday, Argentina’s peso had slumped to a record low, and its bonds were selling off as traders prepared for the weekend election...

item.title: Trump says he'd be willing to extend Asia trip to meet with North Korea's Kim Jong Un
item.description: President Donald Trump noted that he'd be willing to extend his trip to meet with Kim Jong Un of North Korea, if the foreign official wants to meet.

item.title: Brazil’s Lula confident of U.S. trade deal after Trump talks: ‘Heguaranteed to me that we will reach an agreement’
item.description: The 79-year-old Trump wished the 80-year-old Lula a Happy Birthday from aboard Air Force One, saying he was "very impressed" by the "vigorous guy"

item.title: A decade into Saudi Arabia’s Vision 2030, the non-oil sector makes up 56% of $1.3 trillion economy
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Chicago mayor lashes out at reporter over 'illegal alien' term: 'Racist, nasty language'
item.description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson lashes out at reporter over "illegal aliens" phrase, with Rep. Jayapal backing Democratic mayor's stance on immigration.

item.title: Delta CEO predicts Americans will soon be ready to travel to Riyadh as he launches first-ever direct flights from the U.S. to Saudi Arabia
item.description: Acknowledging that "Americans aren't quite sure" about visiting, Delta CEO Ed Bastian told Fortune that the route will be popular—eventually.

item.title: 'Extrajudicial killings': Senators demand answers as Trump expands campaign against drug cartels
item.description: President Trump's military campaign against alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean is drawing bipartisan criticism in the Senate.

item.title: All Jewish councils in key New Jersey area endorse Jack Ciattarelli for governor: report
item.description: Orthodox Jewish leaders across Ocean County unite behind Republican Jack Ciattarelli in historic first for New Jersey politics, forming influential co...

item.title: 'We're going to kill them': Trump makes the war on drugs a reality
item.description: By its own account, the Trump administration has sunk 10 drug boats and slain 43 crew -- and has yet to offer a firm legal justification for it all.

item.title: Unselected Admiration for Emma and Co.
item.description: Author Beth Brower’s heroine comes across as a real person, not a book character.

item.title: A Less Perfect Union
item.description: Abaraonye’s refusal to resign as president-elect of the Oxford Union has brought the Union to the brink of disaster.

item.title: Ex-Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger criticizes nationwide surge in gerrymandering: 'It saddens me'
item.description: Former California Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger expressed deep concern over the growing trend of partisan redistricting across the United States.

item.title: Jay Jones’ ‘Community Service’ Scandal Is Worse Than You Think
item.description: It looks like much of Jay Jones’ court-mandated community service hours were spent advancing his and Democrats' political interests.
